channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Weaponized Copyright Documents Used by Threat Actors to Target Key Employees with Noodlophile Stealer
item.description: The Noodlophile Stealer malware has evolved into a targeted spear-phishing operation that weaponizes copyright infringement notices to infiltrate enterprises with substantial Facebook presences. It employs multilingual content, exploits legitimate software vulnerabilities, and delivers malicious payloads disguised as evidence files.

item.title: New GodRAT Trojan Targets Trading Firms Using Steganography and Gh0st RAT Code
item.description: The article discusses a previously unreported remote access trojan called GodRAT, which delivers shellcode to download malware from a command-and-control server using steganography. The malware is based on Gh0st RAT and has been detected targeting countries in Asia, Europe, and the Middle East since September 2024.

item.title: Pharma firm Inotiv says ransomware attack impacted operations
item.description: American pharmaceutical company Inotiv has been affected by a ransomware attack, which resulted in the encryption of some of its systems and data. The attack was claimed by the Qilin ransomware gang, who allegedly stole around 162,000 files amounting to 176GB and published data samples on their leak site. The incident has caused disruptions to certain business operations, with the company's IT team working to restore affected systems and migrate some operations offline to mitigate the impact.

item.title: Microsoft: August security updates break Windows recovery, reset
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: The August 2025 Windows security updates are breaking reset and recovery operations on systems running Windows 10 and older versions of Windows 11, causing issues with reinstalling the system while keeping files or remotely resetting devices.

item.title: Public Exploit for Chained SAP Flaws Exposes Unpatched Systems to Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324, CVE-2025-42999; Summary: A new exploit combines two previously patched vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-31324 and CVE-2025-42999) to bypass authentication and achieve remote code execution. This allows attackers to upload arbitrary files, execute operating system commands with SAP administrator privileges, and conduct living-off-the-land attacks.

item.title: Surge in Scans From Hacked Cisco, Linksys, and Araknis Routers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Small Business RV series routers, Linksys LRT series, Araknis Networks (AN-300-RT-4L2W); CVE(s): None; Summary: Researchers have identified a significant increase in malicious scanning activities originating from compromised consumer and enterprise networking equipment, with a focus on Cisco, Linksys, and Araknis router models. The compromised devices are being used to conduct reconnaissance scans against internet-connected systems, potentially serving as launching points for more sophisticated attacks.

item.title: SAP 0-Day Exploit Reportedly Leaked by ShinyHunters Hackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324, CVE-2025-42999; Summary: A sophisticated exploit targeting critical SAP vulnerabilities has been publicly released by ShinyHunters, which chains multiple zero-day vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary commands on target SAP systems. The exploit uses a deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2025-42999) to enable "live off the land" attacks and adjusts dynamically based on SAP NetWeaver versions.

item.title: NY Business Council discloses data breach affecting 47,000 people
item.description: The Business Council of New York State (BCNYS) has revealed a data breach that affected over 47,000 individuals, exposing personal, financial, and health information. The attackers stole files containing sensitive information, including names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth, and medical records.

item.title: New Android Attack Targets Indian Users with Free Electricity Subsidy to Install Malware
item.description: A newly identified Android phishing campaign targets Indian users by masquerading as a government initiative offering subsidies for solar rooftop installations. The attackers leverage a fabricated mobile application to deceive victims into installing malware, promising free electricity units and stealing sensitive banking information, contacts, and SMS data.

item.title: U.K. Government Drops Apple Encryption Backdoor Order After U.S. Civil Liberties Pushback
item.description: The UK government has dropped its plan to force Apple to create a backdoor for accessing encrypted user data, following criticism from privacy advocates and Apple's appeals against the legality of the order. This development highlights the ongoing debate between governments seeking access to encrypted data and companies prioritizing user privacy and security.

item.title: Why Your Security Culture is Critical to Mitigating Cyber Risk
item.description: This article discusses the importance of human risk in cybersecurity and how it often goes unaddressed despite being a significant driver of breaches. The author argues that instead of focusing on technology alone, organizations should prioritize cultivating a strong security culture that simplifies and supports secure human behavior. The article provides guidance on evaluating and strengthening an organization's security culture by examining leadership signals, security team engagement, policy design, and security training.

item.title: North Korean Kimsuky Hackers Use GitHub to Target Foreign Embassies with XenoRAT Malware
item.description: The Kimsuky group (APT43) launched a DPRK-linked espionage operation targeting diplomatic missions in South Korea. The campaign involved spear-phishing emails with ZIP files hosting malware, which delivered payloads via Dropbox and Daum, allowing for data exfiltration and payload retrieval over HTTPS.

item.title: Microsoft Defender AI Can Detect Plaintext Credentials in Active Directory
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Active Directory systems; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability lies in the storage of plaintext credentials in free text fields within Active Directory and Microsoft Entra ID systems. This allows attackers to easily exploit the credentials, which are often stored for operational flexibility and simplicity. The AI-powered security capability from Microsoft detects exposed credentials with unprecedented precision, helping organizations eliminate this critical attack vector.

item.title: Ransomware incidents in Japan during the first half of 2025
item.description: This article reports on the increase in ransomware attacks in Japan, with a focus on small and medium-sized enterprises. The most affected industry remains manufacturing, while the ransomware group "Qilin" has been causing the most damage. The article also discusses the emergence of new groups like Kawa4096 and provides details on the tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used by these groups, including the use of the Salsa20 stream cipher for encryption.

item.title: JJ Cummings: The art of controlling information
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability or cybersecurity-relevant content. It appears to be an employee spotlight or career development story featuring JJ Cummings, leader of Cisco's Threat Intelligence and Interdiction team, discussing his role, challenges, and experiences at the company. The article does not contain any threat actor, tactics, infrastructure, scams, or impacts relevant to cybersecurity.

item.title: Fashionable Phishing Bait: GenAI on the Hook
item.description: The article discusses the growing adoption of generative AI (GenAI) and its potential to introduce new risks in cybersecurity. It highlights how GenAI can be misused by threat actors to create realistic phishing content, clone trusted brands, and automate large-scale deployment using services like low-code site builders. The article also provides indicators of these activities to support detection and response efforts.

item.title: PyPI Moves to Stop Domain Resurrection Attacks with Expired Domain Blocks
item.description: The Python Package Index (PyPI) has implemented new security measures to prevent domain resurrection attacks, a type of supply-chain threat that exploits email-based account verification systems. PyPI's solution leverages Domainr's Status API to monitor and update the status of user email addresses associated with domains entering expiration phases, automatically unverifying previously validated email addresses when a domain enters the redemption period.

item.title: Lockbit Linux ESXi Ransomware Variant Reveals Evasion Techniques and File Encryption Process
item.description: The article analyzes a Lockbit ransomware variant targeting Linux-based ESXi servers. It highlights the malware's evasion techniques, operational details, and encryption methods, including its use of ptrace to detect debugging environments and libsodium for key generation.

item.title: Malicious npm Packages Target Crypto Developers to Steal Login Credentials
item.description: This article discusses a threat campaign dubbed "Solana-Scan" that deploys malicious npm packages to infiltrate the Solana cryptocurrency ecosystem. The packages, published by an actor operating under the handle "cryptohan", aim to lure developers in the crypto space and collect sensitive information such as cryptocurrency tokens, wallet credentials, and exchange login details.

item.title: Massive Allianz Life data breach impacts 1.1 million people
item.description: Hackers stole the personal information of 1.1 million individuals in a Salesforce data theft attack that impacted Allianz Life, a U.S. insurance giant, and other high-profile companies worldwide. The attackers tricked employees into linking malicious OAuth apps to their company's Salesforce instance, allowing them to download and steal databases.

item.title: PipeMagic Malware Imitates ChatGPT App to Exploit Windows Vulnerability and Deploy Ransomware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29824; Summary: PipeMagic malware is a modular backdoor that exploits the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) elevation-of-privilege vulnerability. It poses as ChatGPT Desktop Application and enables privilege escalation, ransomware deployment, and command-and-control communication over TCP.

item.title: New Sni5Gect Attack Targets 5G to Steal Messages and Inject Payloads
item.description: The SNI5GECT framework is a sophisticated attack framework that can intercept 5G communications, inject malicious payloads without requiring a rogue base station, and demonstrate multiple attack vectors that pose serious security risks to 5G users.

item.title: CISA Alerts on Active Exploitation of Trend Micro Apex One Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54948; Summary: The vulnerability affects the Trend Micro Apex One Management Console's on-premise deployments, allowing pre-authenticated remote attackers to upload malicious code and execute arbitrary commands, posing significant risks to organizations worldwide.

item.title: PyPI Blocks 1,800 Expired-Domain Emails to Prevent Account Takeovers and Supply Chain Attacks
item.description: The Python Package Index (PyPI) repository now checks for expired domains to prevent supply chain attacks. This change aims to tackle domain resurrection attacks that occur when attackers purchase an expired domain and use it to take control of PyPI accounts through password resets.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Cisco Secure Links to Evade Scanners and Bypass Filters
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Safe Links; CVE(s): None; Summary: Cybercriminals exploit the trust in Cisco's security infrastructure by generating legitimate Cisco Safe Links for malicious purposes. They compromise accounts within Cisco-protected organizations, exploit SaaS services, or recycle active Safe Links to send phishing emails that bypass network filters and evade traditional email security scanners.

item.title: Intel Websites Compromised, Allowing Hackers Access to Employee and Confidential Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Intel; CVE(s): None; Summary: Four internal Intel websites were found to have critical security flaws, exposing personal details of over 270,000 employees and potentially granting attackers access to sensitive corporate information. The vulnerabilities allowed for login bypasses, hardcoded credentials, exposed tokens, and GitHub access token manipulation, enabling unauthorized access and data exfiltration.

item.title: Threat Actors Use Pirated Games to Bypass Microsoft Defender SmartScreen and Adblockers
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated malware campaign where threat actors distribute HijackLoader, a modular malware loader, by leveraging pirated game downloads. The malware bypasses common defenses like adblockers and Microsoft Defender SmartScreen, and its modular architecture allows it to evade detection and persistence mechanisms.

item.title: Blue Locker Ransomware Launches Targeted Attacks on the Oil and Gas Sector in Pakistan
item.description: Blue Locker ransomware has compromised critical infrastructure in Pakistan, including Pakistan Petroleum Limited (PPL), using advanced tactics such as AES-RSA encryption, privilege escalation via registry modifications, and defense evasion through obfuscation and timestomping.

item.title: XenoRAT malware campaign hits multiple embassies in South Korea
item.description: The article discusses a state-sponsored espionage campaign targeting foreign embassies in South Korea, deploying XenoRAT malware from malicious GitHub repositories. The campaign has been ongoing since March and uses spearphishing attacks with contextual email lures and password-protected archives containing obfuscated PowerShell code that retrieves the XenoRAT payload.

item.title: Noodlophile Malware Campaign Expands Global Reach with Copyright Phishing Lures
item.description: Threat actors behind the Noodlophile malware are using spear-phishing emails with updated delivery mechanisms to deploy the information stealer in attacks targeting enterprises in the U.S., Europe, Baltic countries, and the Asia-Pacific region. The campaign leverages advanced spear-phishing emails posing as copyright infringement notices, tailored with reconnaissance-derived details like specific Facebook Page IDs and company ownership information.

item.title: Nebraska man gets 1 year in prison for $3.5M cryptojacking scheme
item.description: A Nebraska man was sentenced to one year in prison for defrauding cloud computing providers of over $3.5 million to mine cryptocurrency worth nearly $1 million. The individual, Charles O. Parks III, used various aliases and corporate entities to create accounts with multiple cloud service providers and laundered the illegal cryptocurrency proceeds using multiple crypto exchanges, online payment services, a New York City non-fungible token (NFT) marketplace, as well as bank accounts.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit Microsoft Help Index File to Deploy PipeMagic Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29824; Summary: The vulnerability allows attackers to escalate privileges from a standard user account, facilitating ransomware deployment by groups like Storm-2460. The exploitation involves the use of a Microsoft Help Index File (.mshi) to deploy the PipeMagic backdoor, marking a notable evolution in malware delivery methods.

item.title: ERMAC Android malware source code leak exposes banking trojan infrastructure
item.description: The source code for ERMAC Android banking trojan version 3.0 has been leaked online, exposing the malware's internals and infrastructure. The latest version targets over 700 banking, shopping, and cryptocurrency apps, with capabilities such as theft of sensitive user information, file access, and device control.

item.title: Weaponized Python Package “termncolor” Uses Windows Run Key for Persistence
item.description: A complex supply chain attack was discovered on the Python Package Index (PyPI), where a seemingly innocuous package "termncolor" imports a malicious dependency "colorinal" that triggers a multi-stage malware deployment. The attack uses DLL sideloading, AES-encrypted payloads, and disguised command-and-control communications to evade detection.

item.title: UK sentences “serial hacker” of 3,000 sites to 20 months in prison
item.description: A UK-based 26-year-old hacker, Al-Tahery Al-Mashriky, has been sentenced to 20 months in prison for hacking thousands of websites and stealing login details of millions of Facebook users. The investigation revealed that Al-Mashriky was linked to extremist groups and used stolen data to target and defraud individuals.

item.title: Over 800 N-able servers left unpatched against critical flaws
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N-able N-central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8875, CVE-2025-8876; Summary: Over 800 N-central servers remain unpatched against two critical security vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-8875 and CVE-2025-8876) that can allow authenticated attackers to inject commands or execute commands on unpatched devices. The flaws are actively exploited, and N-able has patched them in N-central 2025.3.1, urging admins to secure their servers before further information is released.

item.title: Microsoft Windows Vulnerability Exploited to Deploy PipeMagic RansomExx Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29824; Summary: A privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2025-29824) in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) was exploited by threat actors to deploy the PipeMagic malware in RansomExx ransomware attacks. The vulnerability, patched by Microsoft in April 2025, allowed attackers to infiltrate victim infrastructure and deploy a full-fledged backdoor providing remote access and executing commands on compromised hosts.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit Telegram as the Communication Channel to Exfiltrate Stolen Data
item.description: The article describes a phishing campaign targeting public sector clients in Kazakhstan, using Telegram's Bot API as a covert exfiltration channel. The attack employed social engineering tactics and exploited user trust through fake login pages and pre-filled email fields.

item.title: Mozilla warns Germany could soon declare ad blockers illegal
item.description: The German Federal Supreme Court's ruling on browser-based ad blockers has revived a legal battle over whether ad blockers infringe copyright, potentially leading to a ban of the tools in Germany. This could impact other browser extensions and users' choices, as well as raise concerns about a chilling effect on freedom.

item.title: Technical Details of SAP 0-Day Exploitation Script for RCE Revealed
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver's Visual Composer Metadata Uploader; CVE(s): CVE-2025–31324; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in the metadata uploader enables unauthenticated file uploads leading to remote code execution under SAP service account privileges. The exploit script automates the process, allowing attackers to upload arbitrary files and gain persistent access to affected systems.

item.title: Bragg Confirms Cyberattack, Internal IT Systems Breached
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVEs: None; Summary: The Bragg Gaming Group has disclosed a cybersecurity incident that compromised its internal computer systems. The company's preliminary investigation suggests the breach is contained within their internal environment, with no indication of personal information being compromised.

item.title: DoJ Seizes $2.8M in Crypto from Zeppelin Ransomware Group
item.description: The article reports on a law enforcement action against a Zeppelin ransomware operation, resulting in the seizure of over $2.8 million in cryptocurrency and additional assets. The investigation uncovered extensive money laundering operations designed to obscure the criminal origins of ransomware proceeds, highlighting the evolving sophistication of modern ransomware operations.

item.title: CVE-2025-20265: RCE Flaw in Cisco Secure Firewall FMC RADIUS Authentication
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Secure Firewall Management Center Software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20265; Summary: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on targeted systems by exploiting the RADIUS subsystem's insufficient input validation during authentication. An attacker can gain shell-level access, potentially with elevated privileges, if successful.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: NFC Fraud, Curly COMrades, N-able Exploits, Docker Backdoors & More
item.description: This article appears to be a comprehensive cybersecurity news report, covering various topics such as cryptocurrency-related fraud and money laundering, phishing attacks, malware distribution, and other cyber threats. The article does not specifically discuss a vulnerability in software, hardware, or firmware. Therefore, I will not identify any vulnerable products in my response.

item.title: Linux Kernel Netfilter Flaw Enables Privilege Escalation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux kernel's netfilter subsystem; CVE(s): CVE-2024-53141; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter subsystem allows local attackers to escalate privileges through an out-of-bounds write condition. The flaw occurs in the bitmap:ip set type implementation and can be exploited by creating specially crafted ipset bitmap configurations with CIDR ranges that trigger integer underflow conditions, allowing modification of kernel memory structures and potential privilege escalation attacks.

item.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Apex One; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54948; Summary: The Trend Micro Apex One OS Command Injection Vulnerability (CVE-2025-54948) is a newly added vulnerability to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog, indicating active exploitation. This type of vulnerability poses significant risks to the federal enterprise and requires timely remediation to protect against cyberattacks.

item.title: Threat Actors Target Nike, PayPal, and CelcomDigi in New Access and Data Sales
item.description:
This article highlights several significant listings on the dark web, including recruitment efforts targeting employees of top brokerage firms, a large credential dump marketed as PayPal-related, an alleged leak of over 20 million records from Malaysia's CelcomDigi, and unauthorized shell access to Nike USA. The listings demonstrate ongoing risks across sectors.
(Note: Since there are no specific vulnerabilities mentioned in the article, it does not fit into the traditional vulnerability summary format. Instead, I have provided a FYSA-style summary.)

item.title: Microsoft: Recent Windows updates may fail to install via WUSA
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Windows Update Standalone Installer (WUSA) caused Windows update failures when installing updates from a network share on Windows 11 24H2 and Windows Server 2025 systems, resulting in error ERROR_BAD_PATHNAME.

item.title: New Ghost-Tapping Attacks Target Apple Pay and Google Pay Users’ Linked Cards
item.description: Chinese-speaking cybercriminals are using ghost-tapping techniques to take advantage of Near Field Communication (NFC) relay tactics in a sophisticated evolution of payment card fraud, mainly targeting mobile payment services such as Apple Pay and Google Pay. The technique relies on open-source tools like NFCGate for capturing and modifying NFC traffic, allowing real-time emulation of tokenized card data at point-of-sale (POS) terminals or ATMs.

item.title: Malicious PyPI and npm Packages Discovered Exploiting Dependencies in Supply Chain Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PyPI (Python Package Index); CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious package named termncolor was discovered on PyPI that establishes persistence and achieves code execution through a dependency called colorinal. The package uses DLL side-loading to facilitate decryption, establish persistence, and conduct C2 communication, ending in remote code execution.

item.title: Wazuh for Regulatory Compliance
item.description: The article discusses the importance of adherence to regulatory compliance standards and frameworks for organizations handling sensitive data or PII. It highlights various compliance standards and frameworks, including PCI DSS, GDPR, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-53, TSC, and CMMC. The article also introduces Wazuh, an open-source security platform that provides unified XDR and SIEM protection for endpoints and cloud workloads, and explains how it can help organizations track and implement regulatory compliance standards and frameworks.

item.title: North Korean Hackers’ Secret Linux Malware Surfaces Online
item.description: The article discusses a North Korean hacking operation's data leak, which includes a sophisticated Linux rootkit. The rootkit is a Loadable Kernel Module (LKM) that enables kernel system call interception to evade detection and conceals itself from lsmod listings, hides processes, network activity, and persistence files.

item.title: The AI-Powered Trojan Horse Returns: How LLMs Revive Classic Cyber Threats
item.description: The article discusses a new wave of trojan horses that masquerade as legitimate desktop applications. These trojans embed malicious capabilities and are undetected by VirusTotal scanners for weeks. They use Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate convincing websites, error-free content, and AI-curated databases, evading static scanners and highlighting the inadequacy of static signatures alone.

item.title: Workday Data Breach Exposes HR Records via Third-Party CRM Hack
item.description: Workday, an enterprise software giant, disclosed a security incident involving unauthorized access to employee information through a compromised third-party customer relationship management (CRM) platform. Threat actors successfully infiltrated the CRM system following a sophisticated social engineering campaign, gaining access to standard business contact information such as names, email addresses, and phone numbers.

item.title: Scammers Target Back-to-School Deals, Diverting Shoppers to Fraud Sites
item.description: Cybercriminals are exploiting back-to-school season by deploying sophisticated scams, targeting unsuspecting consumers with fake e-commerce sites, and phishing mechanisms. These scams aim to siphon funds and personal data, and can lead to identity theft and financial fraud. Threat actors are using AI-driven tools to create hyper-realistic advertisements, making it harder to detect anomalies in URLs or content.

item.title: HR giant Workday discloses data breach after Salesforce attack
item.description: Workday disclosed a data breach after attackers gained access to a third-party customer relationship management (CRM) platform through a social engineering attack. The incident exposed some business contact information, including names, email addresses, and phone numbers, which could be used in subsequent attacks.

item.title: Hundreds of TeslaMate Servers Expose Real-Time Vehicle Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TeslaMate; CVE(s): None; Summary: TeslaMate servers are exposing sensitive Tesla vehicle data to the public internet without authentication, revealing real-time location tracking, charging patterns, and driving habits of unsuspecting owners. The vulnerability allows anyone with a web browser to access exact GPS coordinates of parked vehicles, track commute patterns, identify home addresses, and determine when cars aren’t present at their usual locations.

item.title: Critical PostgreSQL Flaws Allow Code Injection During Restoration
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PostgreSQL; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8714, CVE-2025-8715, CVE-2025-8713; Summary: The PostgreSQL Global Development Group released emergency security updates to address three critical vulnerabilities that enable code injection attacks during database restoration processes. The flaws affect all supported versions from PostgreSQL 13 through 17 and allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated system privileges.

item.title: Rockwell ControlLogix Ethernet Vulnerability Exposes Systems to Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation ControlLogix Ethernet modules; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7353; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the web-based debugger agent of ControlLogix communication modules allows remote attackers to execute malicious code, perform memory dumps, modify system memory, and control execution flow. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.8 out of 10 and requires no authentication or user interaction for exploitation.

item.title: Top 10 Best Patch Management Software For IT Security 2025
item.description:
FYSA:
The provided article presents a comprehensive analysis of top 10 patch management vendors in 2025, highlighting their unique features, strengths, and potential limitations. The article aims to help organizations make informed decisions when selecting a patch management solution that best suits their specific needs.
In this response, I will analyze the article's content, focusing on the various factors that influence an organization's choice of a patch management vendor. Key considerations include the size and complexity of the IT environment, operating systems and applications diversity, budget, and existing security infrastructure.
The article provides an overview of each vendor, highlighting their respective strengths in areas such as automation, scalability, ease of use, and customization. It also mentions potential limitations or areas for improvement within each solution.
In conclusion, this article presents a valuable resource for organizations seeking to evaluate patch management vendors and make informed decisions about their security posture.

item.title: OpenAI releases warmer GPT-5 personality, but only for non thinking model
item.description: OpenAI has rolled out a new "warmer" personality for GPT-5 and restored older models like GPT-4o. Additionally, the company has relaxed rate limits for paid users after user outrage.

item.title: Google is adding "Projects" feature to Gemini to run research tasks
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability, but it contains cybersecurity-relevant content. The article discusses Google's Gemini feature called "Projects" and its upcoming API release. It also mentions previous Gemini-related vulnerabilities, such as hijacking email summaries for phishing, and a flaw in the CLI AI coding assistant that allowed stealthy code execution.

item.title: U.S. seizes $2.8 million in crypto from Zeppelin ransomware operator
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) seized over $2.8 million in cryptocurrency from suspected ransomware operator Ianis Aleksandrovich Antropenko, linked to the Zeppelin ransomware operation. The seizure is part of efforts to disrupt and prevent ransomware operators from using funds to rebuild infrastructure or recruit new members.

item.title: Anthropic: Claude can now end conversations to prevent harmful uses
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: This article discusses updates to the AI model "Claude" by Anthropic, including a new feature that allows it to end conversations when it feels harm or abuse. The company also reports on other developments and comparisons with OpenAI's GPT-5 and ChatGPT models.

item.title: Elastic EDR 0-Day Flaw Lets Hackers Evade Detection, Run Malware, and Trigger BSOD
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Elastic Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) software; CVE(s): None; Summary: A zero-day vulnerability in the Microsoft-signed kernel driver "elastic-endpoint-driver.sys" allows attackers to bypass security measures, execute malicious code, and crash protected systems repeatedly. The flaw enables a four-step attack chain, including EDR Bypass, Remote Code Execution, Persistence, and Privileged Denial-of-Service.

item.title: OpenAI prepares Chromium-based AI browser to take on Google
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability. It discusses OpenAI's development of an AI-powered browser using Chromium as its underlying engine and its potential features.

item.title: Leak: ChatGPT cheaper plan costs $4 or £3.50, might release everywhere
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: The article discusses OpenAI's upcoming plan called ChatGPT Go, which will be available globally and priced at $4. Additionally, the company has added a "Voice speed" feature to the ChatGPT web app settings for voice mode.

item.title: OpenAI is improving ChatGPT voice mode
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: OpenAI has added features such as "Voice speed" and "custom instructions prefix" to the ChatGPT web app settings. Additionally, they have rolled out an upgraded model selector with access to new GPT-5 models and restored GPT-4o for paid users.

item.title: PoC Released for Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiSIEM; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25256; Summary: A severe pre-authentication command injection vulnerability exists in Fortinet's FortiSIEM platform, allowing attackers to compromise enterprise security monitoring systems without credentials. The vulnerability affects all versions from 5.4 through 7.3.1 and requires complete migration to fixed releases for older versions.

item.title: Researcher to release exploit for full auth bypass on FortiWeb
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet, FortiWeb; CVE(s): CVE-2025-52970; Summary: A remote attacker can bypass FortiWeb's authentication by exploiting an out-of-bounds read in cookie parsing that sets the Era parameter to an unexpected value. This allows the server to use an all-zero secret key for session encryption and HMAC signing, making forged authentication cookies trivial to create.

item.title: Microsoft Teams to protect against malicious URLs, dangerous file types
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: This article is not about a vulnerability, but rather about various security enhancements and features being added to Microsoft Teams, including blocking malicious URLs and files, integrating with Microsoft Defender for Office 365, and preventing unauthorized screen captures. These features aim to improve protection against malware and phishing attacks.

item.title: Threat Actors Abuse npm Developer Accounts Hijacked to Spread Malicious Packages
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm (multiple packages); CVE(s): None; Summary: A sophisticated phishing campaign targeting the maintainer of eslint-config-prettier led to malicious code being distributed to thousands of developer projects worldwide, highlighting critical vulnerabilities in modern software development practices and automated dependency updating tools. The attack began with a carefully crafted phishing email that impersonated npm's official support team, leading to the publication of compromised packages containing postinstall scripts that deployed a remote access trojan specifically targeting Windows machines.

item.title: ERMAC V3.0 Banking Trojan Source Code Leak Exposes Full Malware Infrastructure
item.description: The article discusses the inner workings of an Android banking trojan called ERMAC 3.0, revealing its infrastructure and capabilities, including form injection methods, data theft, and command-and-control (C2) panel.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Exploit Web Hosting Infrastructure for Cyberattacks
item.description: The article reveals a sophisticated Chinese-speaking advanced persistent threat (APT) group, designated UAT-7237, that has been actively targeting web hosting infrastructure in Taiwan since at least 2022. The group demonstrates a refined approach to maintaining persistent access and employs distinct tactics to establish long-term presence in high-value environments, including custom shellcode loading, VPN-based persistence, cloud infrastructure, and evasion techniques.

item.title: Russian Group EncryptHub Exploits MSC EvilTwin Vulnerability to Deploy Fickle Stealer Malware
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26633; Summary: The vulnerability in the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) framework was exploited by EncryptHub to deliver malicious payloads. The exploit uses social engineering techniques and a rogue MSC file to trigger the infection routine, ultimately leading to the execution of PowerShell commands that download and run additional malware.
FYSA: EncryptHub is continuing to exploit vulnerabilities and use social engineering tactics to deliver malicious payloads. They are using fake job offers, portfolio reviews, and compromised Steam games to infect targets with stealer malware. The group is also abusing trusted platforms like Brave Support to host next-stage malware and setting up phony videoconferencing lures to deceive victims into downloading malicious software.

item.title: Top 10 Best NDR Solutions (Network Detection and Response) in 2025
item.description:
The article provides an analysis of various Network Detection and Response (NDR) solutions from different vendors. It highlights the key features, strengths, and capabilities of each NDR solution, including their ability to detect advanced threats, provide comprehensive visibility into network traffic, and offer automated investigation and response capabilities.
The analysis covers a range of NDR solutions from well-known vendors such as Fidelis, NetWitness, and Trend Micro. It provides insights into the unique strengths and specializations of each solution, helping readers understand which NDR might best suit their specific security needs.
The article also emphasizes the importance of NDR in modern cybersecurity, highlighting its role in detecting and responding to threats that bypass traditional security controls.

item.title: Mobile Phishers Target Brokerage Accounts in ‘Ramp and Dump’ Cashout Scheme
item.description: Cybercriminal groups are using sophisticated phishing kits to convert stolen card data into mobile wallets, and have recently shifted their focus to targeting customers of brokerage services. They use compromised accounts in unison to manipulate stock prices, exploiting weaknesses in multi-factor authentication methods used by some financial institutions.

item.title: 10 Best Free Data Recovery Software 2025
item.description:
FYSA:
As a cybersecurity analyst, I analyzed the article and found it to be an informative piece on free data recovery tools for Windows and Mac operating systems. The article highlights 10 different software tools that can help users recover lost files from various storage devices.
The tools mentioned include Recuva, Stellar Data Recovery, Glary Undelete, MiniTool Power Data Recovery, ADRC Data Recovery Tools, PhotoRec, etc. Each tool has its unique features and capabilities, making it suitable for a wide range of users.
While the article does not discuss any specific vulnerabilities or security threats related to these data recovery tools, I would like to highlight that the best practice is to only download software from trusted sources and be cautious when using third-party downloaders or deals.
Additionally, it is essential to note that while these free data recovery tools can be helpful in recovering lost files, they may not always be effective, especially if the deleted data has been written over or if the recording medium has been physically damaged. Therefore, it's crucial for users to act quickly when realizing they have lost files and use the right tool for their specific situation.

item.title: Taiwan Web Servers Breached by UAT-7237 Using Customized Open-Source Hacking Tools
item.description: A Chinese-speaking advanced persistent threat (APT) actor, tracked as UAT-7237, targets web infrastructure entities in Taiwan using customized open-sourced tools with the aim of establishing long-term access within high-value victim environments. The group relies on exploitation of known security flaws against unpatched servers and uses various tools such as Cobalt Strike, SoundBill, JuicyPotato, and Mimikatz to carry out malicious activities.

item.title: Colt Telecom attack claimed by WarLock ransomware, data up for sale
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770; Summary: The article reports a cyberattack on UK-based telecommunications company Colt Technology Services, causing a multi-day outage of some operations. Initial access was likely gained by exploiting a remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint tracked as CVE-2025-53770.

item.title: Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and Secure Firewall Flaws Allow Remote DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Systems; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20224, CVE-2025-20225, CVE-2025-20239, CVE-2025-20252, CVE-2025-20253, and CVE-2025-20254; Summary: Six critical vulnerabilities in the Internet Key Exchange Version 2 (IKEv2) feature across Cisco's networking and security product portfolio allow unauthenticated remote attackers to launch denial-of-service attacks, potentially causing system crashes and service disruptions. The most severe vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 8.6, indicating high severity with potential for significant impact on affected systems.

item.title: Cisco warns of max severity flaw in Firewall Management Center
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Secure Firewall Management Center (FMC) software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20265, None for other vulnerabilities; Summary: A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability exists in the RADIUS subsystem of Cisco FMC software, allowing an unauthenticated attacker to inject arbitrary shell commands with elevated privileges. The vulnerability affects FMC versions 7.0.7 and 7.7.0 when RADIUS authentication is enabled.

item.title: Microsoft reminds of Windows 10 support ending in two months
item.description: None

item.title: MadeYouReset: New HTTP/2 DoS Vulnerability Explained
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various HTTP/2 servers; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8671, CVE-2025-48989, CVE-2025-55163, CVE-2025-54500, CVE-2025-36047; Summary: A newly discovered technique called "MadeYouReset" allows attackers to coax HTTP/2 servers into resetting their own streams, bypassing many Rapid Reset defenses. The attack works by sending normal-looking HTTP/2 frames that cause subtle protocol violations, forcing the server to issue its own resets and increasing resource pressure.

item.title: F5 Fixes HTTP/2 Flaw Affecting Multiple Products in Massive DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: F5 Networks BIG-IP products; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54500; Summary: The vulnerability, known as the "HTTP/2 MadeYouReset Attack", exploits a flaw in HTTP/2 implementation that enables attackers to overwhelm systems using specially crafted control frames, potentially causing denial-of-service conditions. Malformed HTTP/2 control frames bypass the maximum concurrent streams limit, leading to CPU resource exhaustion and denial-of-service conditions.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: Void Blizzard
item.description:
FYSA:
Void Blizzard is a newly identified Russian state-sponsored cyber threat group that targets governments, defense sectors, critical infrastructure, and high-tech companies in NATO and EU countries. The group uses simple but effective techniques, including "living off the land" methods, stolen credentials, and phishing attacks. Void Blizzard has achieved high success rates by exploiting cloud APIs like Microsoft Graph and Exchange Online, as well as using automation and rapid access to compromised systems.

item.title: ImageMagick Vulnerabilities Cause Memory Corruption and Integer Overflows
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ImageMagick; CVE(s): CVE-2025-55154, CVE-2025-55004, CVE-2025-55005, and CVE-2025-55160; Summary: Four critical security vulnerabilities affecting millions of applications that rely on ImageMagick for image processing have been patched. The flaws include integer overflows in MNG magnification calculations, heap-buffer overflows during image magnification, and undefined behavior in CloneSplayTree operations.

item.title: Phishing Campaign Exploits Japanese Character “ん” to Imitate Forward Slash
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated phishing campaign that exploits the Japanese hiragana character "ん" to create deceptively authentic-looking URLs. The campaign targets Booking.com customers, using URLs that appear legitimate but actually redirect victims to malicious domains. The attacks are challenging to identify due to their refinement and rely on social engineering techniques rather than technical vulnerabilities.

item.title: Plex warns users to patch security vulnerability immediately
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Plex Media Server; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports a recently patched security vulnerability in Plex Media Server versions 1.41.7.x to 1.42.0.x, with no additional details provided about the patch or the vulnerability itself. Users are advised to update their software as soon as possible to prevent exploitation by threat actors.

item.title: U.S. Sanctions Garantex and Grinex Over $100M in Ransomware-Linked Illicit Crypto Transactions
item.description: The US Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) has renewed sanctions against Russian cryptocurrency exchange platform Garantex for facilitating ransomware actors and other cybercriminals. Garantex is accused of processing over $100 million in transactions linked to illicit activities since 2019, with its successor Grinex allegedly continuing these activities.

item.title: Zero Trust + AI: Privacy in the Age of Agentic AI
item.description: The article discusses the concept of agentic AI, which is becoming increasingly autonomous in its decision-making processes. It highlights how this type of AI can infer and interpret data, making assumptions and acting on partial signals. The article emphasizes that privacy in a world of minds (both biological and synthetic) is no longer just about secrecy but rather reciprocity, alignment, and governance.

item.title: UAT-7237 targets Taiwanese web hosting infrastructure
item.description: UAT-7237 is a Chinese-speaking advanced persistent threat (APT) group that has been active since at least 2022, targeting web infrastructure entities in Taiwan. They use open-sourced tooling, customized to evade detection, and employ tactics such as using Cobalt Strike, Mimikatz, and JuicyPotato for credential extraction and privilege escalation. The group also uses SoftEther VPN clients and exploits known vulnerabilities on unpatched servers.

item.title: VirtualBox 7.2 Adds Windows 11/Arm VM Support and Key Bug Fixes
item.description: The article discusses the release of VirtualBox 7.2.0, a major update that enhances ARM virtualization capabilities and introduces comprehensive Windows 11/ARM support. The update also includes performance enhancements, interface redesigns, and addresses critical issues.

item.title: HexStrike AI Links ChatGPT, Claude, and Copilot to 150+ Security Tools
item.description: This article is about the integration of ChatGPT, Claude, and GitHub Copilot with HexStrike AI's autonomous cybersecurity framework. It enables these AI agents to orchestrate over 150 professional security tools for comprehensive penetration testing and vulnerability intelligence.

item.title: Palo Alto GlobalProtect Vulnerability Allows Privilege Escalation via Certificate Bypass
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect App; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2183; Summary: A vulnerability in the GlobalProtect app allows attackers to escalate privileges, install malicious software, and bypass security controls by exploiting improper certificate validation. The flaw affects multiple versions of the VPN client across Windows and Linux platforms, with Windows and Linux systems bearing the primary risk.

item.title: US sanctions Grinex crypto-exchange, successor to Garantex
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has announced sanctions against Grinex, a cryptocurrency exchange suspected to be a rebrand of previously sanctioned Garantex, which was linked to ransomware gangs and laundered money for cybercriminals. The sanctions also target three co-founders and six partner companies allegedly involved with Garantex.

item.title: Source Code of ERMAC V3.0 Malware Exposed by ‘changemeplease’ Password
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ERMAC V3.0; CVE(s): None; Summary: The complete source code of ERMAC V3.0, a sophisticated banking trojan, was exposed due to a weak default password "changemeplease". The leak reveals multiple critical security flaws, including hardcoded JWT secret token, static admin bearer token, and default root credentials, which can be exploited to disrupt ERMAC operations.

item.title: 10 Best Managed Detection And Response (MDR) Companies in 2025
item.description: I have analyzed the article and it does not appear to be discussing a specific software, hardware, or firmware vulnerability. Instead, it appears to be an overview of different Managed Detection and Response (MDR) services offered by various cybersecurity companies. The article provides information about each company's MDR offerings, highlighting their unique features, strengths, and approaches.

item.title: Cisco Secure Firewall Snort 3 Vulnerability Enable DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense Software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20217; Summary: The vulnerability in the Snort 3 Detection Engine allows unauthenticated remote attackers to launch denial of service (DoS) attacks, potentially disrupting critical network operations. Exploitation involves sending specially crafted traffic through the affected device, causing an infinite loop during packet inspection, and can be mitigated only by applying available security updates.

item.title: Cisco Warns of CVSS 10.0 FMC RADIUS Flaw Allowing Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Secure Firewall Management Center (FMC) Software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20265; Summary: The vulnerability affects the RADIUS subsystem implementation and could permit an unauthenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary shell commands that are executed by the device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute commands at a high privilege level, requiring Cisco Secure FMC Software to be configured for RADIUS authentication for the web-based management interface, SSH management, or both.

item.title: HTTP/2 MadeYouReset Vulnerability Enables Massive DDoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: HTTP/2 protocol; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8671; Summary: The "MadeYouReset" vulnerability allows attackers to bypass HTTP/2's concurrency limits, enabling unbounded concurrent work on target servers with minimal resources, potentially leading to massive DDoS attacks and overwhelming servers.

item.title: Cisco Secure Firewall Vulnerability Lets Attackers Execute Remote Shell Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Secure Firewall Management Center; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20265; Summary: The vulnerability in Cisco Secure Firewall Management Center's RADIUS subsystem allows unauthenticated attackers to remotely execute shell commands with elevated privileges, potentially gaining high-level system access without prior authentication. This can lead to complete control over the firewall management system and potential further network attacks.

item.title: Ransomware Actors Combine Legitimate Tools with Custom Malware to Evade Detection
item.description: The article discusses the Crypto24 strain's multi-stage attacks, which employ legitimate system tools and bespoke malware to infiltrate networks, maintain persistence, and evade EDR systems. The attacks target high-profile organizations across various sectors, using tools like PSExec, AnyDesk, and keyloggers to exfiltrate data via Google Drive.

item.title: Over $300 million in cybercrime crypto seized in anti-fraud effort
item.description:
FYSA:
The article discusses two initiatives involving law enforcement and private companies that have resulted in the freezing of over $300 million worth of cryptocurrency linked to cybercrime and fraud schemes. The initiatives, led by the T3 Financial Crime Unit and Chainalysis, involved coordinated investigations and global collaboration to detect and intervene at the blockchain level, significantly hindering cybercriminals from moving or spending scam proceeds.

item.title: ZDI-25-846: Apple macOS USD importMeshJointWeights Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31281; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple macOS. Interaction with the USD library is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: Threat Actors Leverage CrossC2 to Extend Cobalt Strike to Linux and macOS
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CrossC2; CVE(s): None; Summary: CrossC2 is an unofficial extension tool that creates Cobalt Strike Beacons that work with Linux and macOS. It was used by threat actors to target Active Directory infrastructures, exploiting Linux servers as potential entry points and capitalizing on the frequent absence of endpoint detection and response (EDR) systems in such environments. The tool integrates custom loaders, including ReadNimeLoader, and employs anti-analysis measures and sophisticated anti-debugging techniques.

item.title: PS1Bot: Multi-Stage Malware Framework Targeting Windows Systems
item.description: The article discusses a malware campaign, dubbed PS1Bot, which has been active since early 2025. The malware uses malvertising and SEO poisoning to distribute compressed archives with file names mimicking legitimate search queries. Upon extraction, the archives contain a JavaScript file that downloads PowerShell scripts from an attacker-controlled server, which poll a command-and-control (C2) server and execute in-memory to minimize disk artifacts and enhance stealth.

item.title: What happened in Vegas (that you actually want to know about)
item.description: The article discusses various cybersecurity-related topics, including threat actors, tactics, infrastructure, and impacts. It mentions Russian government hackers allegedly being behind a data breach affecting the US federal court filing system, as well as North Korean state-sponsored hacking group Kimsuky suffering a data breach. Additionally, it warns about a widespread malvertising campaign distributing malware that steals sensitive information and maintains persistent access on infected systems.

item.title: Crypto24 ransomware hits large orgs with custom EDR evasion tool
item.description: Crypto24 ransomware group uses custom utilities to evade security solutions, exfiltrate data, and encrypt files. The group has been identified using default administrative accounts on Windows systems, creating malicious services and tasks, and disabling security agents from multiple vendors.

item.title: New NFC-Based PhantomCard Malware Targets Android Banking Users
item.description: PhantomCard is a sophisticated NFC-based Trojan designed to relay sensitive card data from victims' devices to cybercriminals. It operates by masquerading as a legitimate "card protection" app and exploits the NFC reader in modern Android devices, focusing on the ISO-DEP protocol standard used in EMV contactless cards.

item.title: Threat Actors Use Advanced Tactics to Personalize Phishing for Malware Delivery
item.description: Threat actors are using topic customization as a more advanced strategy in targeted malware-delivery phishing campaigns. The approach involves crafting personalized subject lines, attachment names, and embedded links to mimic authentic communications, evading detection and facilitating successful compromises. Key insights reveal that when combined with Remote Access Trojans (RATs) or Information Stealers, these campaigns can grant attackers remote access or harvest credentials.

item.title: Google Mandates License or Certification for Crypto App Developers
item.description:
FYSA:
The article highlights the cryptocurrency ecosystem's ongoing challenges in balancing accessibility with security, as regulatory frameworks evolve. The Google Play requires developers to meet stringent publishing requirements, and the FBI warns of sophisticated recovery scams targeting previous fraud victims. The article emphasizes the importance of vigilance against compliance failures and criminal exploitation, as the industry seeks legitimacy and sustainable growth.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Microsoft Flaw to Breach Canadian House of Commons to Gain Unauthorized Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-49704, and CVE-2025-49706; Summary: A vulnerability in Microsoft SharePoint was exploited by an unidentified threat actor to access sensitive government employee data at the Canadian House of Commons. The attack allowed unauthorized remote code execution through advanced deserialization techniques and ViewState abuse, bypassing authentication controls including multi-factor authentication and single sign-on systems.

item.title: Pro-Russian hackers blamed for water dam sabotage in Norway
item.description: Pro-Russian hackers took control of critical operation systems at a dam in Norway, opening outflow valves and demonstrating their ability to remotely hack critical infrastructure. The attack was seen as a display of capabilities rather than an attempt to cause damage, with the goal of exerting influence and creating fear or unrest in the population. This is the second time Russia has been associated with attacks against Norwegian entities.

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Dominates July with Over 70 Claimed Victims
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2023-48788, CVE-2019-18935, CVE-2025-5777, CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-53771, CVE-2025-49704, and CVE-2025-49706; Summary: A variety of vulnerabilities were weaponized in ransomware campaigns, including SQL injection flaws in Fortinet FortiClientEMS (CVE-2023-48788) and deserialization vulnerability in Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX (CVE-2019-18935), as well as out-of-bounds read issue in Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway (CVE-2025-5777) and Microsoft SharePoint flaws (CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-53771, CVE-2025-49704, and CVE-2025-49706). These exploits facilitated initial access and lateral movement, enabling attackers to deploy payloads efficiently.

item.title: New HTTP/2 'MadeYouReset' Vulnerability Enables Large-Scale DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Tomcat; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48989, None (for other impacted products); Summary: MadeYouReset is an attack technique that bypasses server-imposed limits on HTTP/2 requests, allowing thousands of concurrent requests and inducing denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. The vulnerability takes advantage of stream errors and the use of RST_STREAM frames to trigger protocol violations in unexpected ways, prompting the server to reset streams and exhaust resources.

item.title: ZDI-25-838: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows 11 vhdmp Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): CVE-2025-50167; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the Virtual Hard Disk Miniport driver due to lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on it.

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server bug causing cluster, VM issues
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows Server 2019; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Cluster service on Windows Server 2019 may fail to function correctly after installing the July Windows security update, causing nodes to fail to rejoin the cluster or enter quarantine states, virtual machines to experience multiple restarts, and frequent errors.

item.title: ZDI-25-839: Microsoft Teams Real Time Media Manager Integer Underflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Teams; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53783; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microsoft Teams without authentication. The issue results from an integer underflow before writing to memory, which can be leveraged by attackers to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-840: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows 11 vhdmp Improper Validation of Array Index Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11 vhdmp; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53155; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows by exploiting an improper validation of array index in the Virtual Hard Disk Miniport driver, which can result in a write past the end of an array.

item.title: ZDI-25-841: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows 11 vhdmp Integer Overflow Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53723; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows by exploiting an integer overflow in the Virtual Hard Disk Miniport driver, resulting in an elevated SYSTEM context. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: ZDI-25-842: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows Exposed Dangerous Function Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53156; Summary: The vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must execute low-privileged code to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the Windows Storage Port Driver due to an exposed dangerous function.

item.title: ZDI-25-843: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows win32kbase Type Confusion Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-50168; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows by exploiting a type confusion condition in the win32kbase driver. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution on the target system to exploit this vulnerability, which can result in arbitrary code execution in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-844: Microsoft Windows Subsystem for Linux WslCoreVm::Initialize Incorrect Privilege Management Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53788; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to read arbitrary files on affected installations of Microsoft Windows, requiring low-privileged code execution. The issue exists within WslCoreVm::Initialize method due to incorrect privilege management.

item.title: ZDI-25-845: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft Windows win32kfull Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53132; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the win32kfull driver due to a lack of proper locking when performing operations on an object.

item.title: Booking.com phishing campaign uses sneaky 'ん' character to trick you
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting the Japanese hiragana character "ん" (Unicode U+3093) in a new phishing campaign, making URLs appear realistic to a casual glance. The attack creates fake Booking.com links that direct users to malicious sites, delivering malware and potentially leading to infostealers or remote access trojans.

item.title: When Theft Replaces Encryption: Blue Report 2025 on Ransomware & Infostealers
item.description: The article discusses the evolving threat landscape, revealing that ransomware operators and infostealer campaigns focus on credential theft, data exfiltration, and lateral movement. It highlights the failure of organizations to detect these tactics, with a 3% prevention rate for data exfiltration, and a 46% success rate for password cracking.

item.title: Hackers Found Using CrossC2 to Expand Cobalt Strike Beacon’s Reach to Linux and macOS
item.description: The article reports on a command-and-control (C2) framework called CrossC2 being used in attacks to extend Cobalt Strike's functionality to Linux and Apple macOS. The attacks targeted multiple countries, including Japan, and involved the use of custom malware as a loader for Cobalt Strike, as well as various tools such as PsExec, Plink, and Cobalt Strike itself.

item.title: Canada’s House of Commons investigating data breach after cyberattack
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770, CVE-2025-53786; Summary: A threat actor exploited a recent Microsoft vulnerability to gain access to a database containing sensitive information used to manage House of Commons computers and mobile devices. The attack also resulted in the theft of some employee data, including names, job titles, office locations, and email addresses.
FYSA: The article reports on a data breach affecting the House of Commons of Canada, where a threat actor exploited a Microsoft vulnerability to gain access to sensitive information. The stolen data could be used to target and impersonate parliamentarians or exploited in scams.

item.title: CVE-2025-25256: FortiSIEM Flaw Enables Unauthenticated RCE
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiSIEM; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25256; Summary: The vulnerability is an OS command injection flaw (CWE-78) that allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on affected systems. The exploit code has been identified in the wild, making it critical for organizations using vulnerable versions to act fast and upgrade or migrate to supported releases.

item.title: CISA Publishes Operational Technology Guide for Critical Infrastructure Stakeholders
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released a comprehensive guide, "Foundations for OT Cybersecurity: Asset Inventory Guidance for Owners and Operators," to help critical infrastructure stakeholders develop and maintain operational technology (OT) asset inventories and taxonomies. The guide provides best practices for creating an OT taxonomy and highlights the importance of integrating the inventory into broader cybersecurity and risk management efforts.

item.title: Microsoft IIS Web Deploy Vulnerability Allows Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft IIS Web Deploy; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53772; Summary: The vulnerability allows authenticated attackers with low-level privileges to potentially gain complete control over vulnerable systems by exploiting the deserialization process, allowing remote code execution. This flaw stems from improper deserialization of untrusted data within the Web Deploy framework and affects the core functionality of Web Deploy, making it a significant security concern for organizations using IIS Web Deploy.

item.title: Siemens RUGGEDCOM APE1808
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens RUGGEDCOM APE1808; CVE(s): CVE-2024-13089, CVE-2024-13090; Summary: An authenticated administrator can execute unauthorized arbitrary OS commands due to an OS command injection vulnerability and a privilege escalation vulnerability. Successful exploitation could impact confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

item.title: Siemens Opcenter Quality
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Opcenter Quality; CVE(s): CVE-2024-41979, CVE-2024-41980, CVE-2024-41982, CVE-2024-41983, CVE-2024-41984, CVE-2024-41985, CVE-2024-41986; Summary: The vulnerabilities in Siemens Opcenter Quality allow an attacker to gain complete access of the application, access sensitive information, execute a Machine-In-The-Middle attack, and compromise confidentiality and integrity of data. Successful exploitation could also lead to unauthorized access if sessions are left idle.

item.title: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Viewpoint
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Viewpoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7973; Summary: The vulnerability in FactoryTalk Viewpoint version 14.00 and prior allows attackers to hijack the cscript.exe console window, which runs with SYSTEM privileges, enabling full privilege escalation. Successful exploitation could result in full privilege escalation.

item.title: Siemens Simcenter Femap
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Simcenter Femap V2406 and V2412; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40762, CVE-2025-40764; Summary: The vulnerabilities in Siemens Simcenter Femap allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process by exploiting out-of-bounds write and read vulnerabilities while parsing specially crafted STP and BMP files.

item.title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-PLCSIM
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIMATIC S7-PLCSIM, SIMOCODE ES, SIMOTION SCOUT TIA, SINAMICS Startdrive, SIMATIC STEP 7, SIMATIC WinCC, SIRIUS Safety ES, SIRIUS Soft Starter ES, and TIA Portal Cloud; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40759; Summary: A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability exists in the affected Siemens products, which could allow an attacker to cause a type confusion and execute arbitrary code. Successful exploitation requires low attack complexity.

item.title: Siemens Engineering Platforms
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens; CVE(s): CVE-2024-54678; Summary: A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability in Siemens' products allows a local authenticated attacker to cause a type confusion and execute arbitrary code within the affected application. The vulnerability affects various products including SIMATIC PCS neo, SIMATIC WinCC, SIMOCODE ES, SIMOTION SCOUT TIA, SINAMICS Startdrive, SIRIUS Safety ES, SIRIUS Soft Starter ES, TIA Portal Cloud, and TIA Portal Test Suite.

item.title: CISA Releases Thirty-Two Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released 32 Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on August 14, 2025, providing timely information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. These advisories cover various products from Siemens and Rockwell Automation, including SIMATIC RTLS Locating Manager, COMOS, and others.

item.title: Siemens RUGGEDCOM ROX II
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens RUGGEDCOM ROX II Family; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33023; Summary: The vulnerability allows an authenticated remote attacker with high privileges in the web interface to upload arbitrary files, which could lead to a higher level of attack complexity. Exploitation could allow an attacker to upload files onto the filesystem of devices.

item.title: Siemens SIPROTEC 5
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIPROTEC 5; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40570; Summary: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling vulnerability in Siemens SIPROTEC 5 devices allows an attacker with physical access to send specially crafted packets with high bandwidth, forcing the device to exhaust its memory and stop responding to any network traffic via the local USB port.

item.title: Siemens RUGGEDCOM CROSSBOW Station Access Controller
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens RUGGEDCOM CROSSBOW Station Access Controller (SAC); CVE(s): CVE-2025-3277, CVE-2025-29087, CVE-2025-29088; Summary: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or create a denial-of-service condition. The vulnerabilities are due to a heap-based buffer overflow and integer overflow in SQLite's 'concat_ws()' function, which can result in wild Heap Buffer overflows of size 4GB.

item.title: Siemens Wibu CodeMeter Runtime
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIMATIC Information Server, WinCC OA, and Process Historian; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47809; Summary: A least privilege violation vulnerability in Wibu CodeMeter allows a local user to navigate from Import License to a privileged instance of Windows Explorer. Successful exploitation could allow a local user to elevate privileges. The vulnerability affects various Siemens products and versions, including SIMATIC Information Server 2020, WinCC OA V3.18/V3.19, and Process Historian 2020/2022/2024.

item.title: Rockwell FactoryTalk Linx
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Linx; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7972; Summary: A vulnerability exists in the FactoryTalk Linx Network Browser, allowing an attacker to disable FTSP token validation by modifying the process.env.NODE_ENV variable. This enables access to create, update, and delete FTLinx drivers, with a CVSS v4 score of 8.4.

item.title: Siemens SINEC Traffic Analyzer
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SINEC Traffic Analyzer (6GK8822-1BG01-0BA0); CVE(s): CVE-2024-24989, CVE-2024-24990, CVE-2025-40766, CVE-2025-40767, CVE-2025-40768, CVE-2025-40769, CVE-2025-40770; Summary: The Siemens SINEC Traffic Analyzer has multiple vulnerabilities that could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition or gain elevated access and access to sensitive resources. The vulnerabilities include NULL Pointer Dereference, Use After Free, Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, Execution with Unnecessary Privileges, Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor, Irrelevant Code, and Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint.

item.title: Siemens SIMATIC RTLS Locating Manager
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIMATIC RTLS Locating Manager; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40746; Summary: The vulnerability allows an authenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with high privileges due to improper input validation. Exploitation could result in the execution of arbitrary code with 'NT Authority/SYSTEM' privileges, posing a significant risk to critical infrastructure sectors such as Critical Manufacturing worldwide.

item.title: Siemens SIPROTEC 4 and SIPROTEC 4 Compact
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIPROTEC 4 and SIPROTEC 4 Compact; CVE(s): CVE-2024-52504; Summary: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition. The affected devices do not properly handle interrupted operations of file transfer, requiring the devices to be restarted to restore normal operations.

item.title: Siemens COMOS
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens COMOS; CVE(s): CVE-2024-8894; Summary: The vulnerability, an out-of-bounds write, allows an attacker to cause a crash, potentially enabling a denial-of-service attack or code execution. The affected products are all versions of COMOS prior to V10.6, and exploitation requires reading crafted DWF files and missing proper checks on received SectionIterator data.

item.title: Siemens BFCClient
item.description: Siemens will no longer update ICS security advisories for vulnerabilities beyond the initial advisory as of January 10, 2023. The vulnerabilities affect BFCClient versions prior to 2.17 and are related to buffer copy without checking size of input, out-of-bounds read, loop with unreachable exit condition, access of resource using incompatible type, and improper certificate validation. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to read memory contents, change application behavior, or create a denial-of-service condition.

item.title: Siemens SIMOTION SCOUT, SIMOTION SCOUT TIA, and SINAMICS STARTER
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SIMOTION SCOUT, SIMOTION SCOUT TIA, SINAMICS STARTER; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40584; Summary: The affected application contains a XML External Entity Injection (XXE) vulnerability while parsing specially crafted XML files. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to read arbitrary files in the system.

item.title: Rockwell Automation Micro800
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation Micro800; CVE(s): CVE-2023-48691, CVE-2023-48692, CVE-2023-48693, CVE-2025-7693; Summary: The Rockwell Automation Micro800 has several vulnerabilities that allow for remote code execution or privilege escalation due to improper input validation and dependency on vulnerable third-party components.

item.title: Rockwell Automation Studio 5000 Logix Designer
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation Studio 5000 Logix Designer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7971; Summary: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to crash the device or execute malicious code. The vulnerability exists due to improper input validation and affects versions 36.00.02 to 37.00.02.

item.title: Siemens SICAM Q100/Q200
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SICAM Q100 and Q200; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40752, CVE-2025-40753; Summary: Cleartext storage of sensitive information in Siemens POWER METER SICAM Q100 and Q200 allows an authenticated local attacker to extract the SMTP account password and use the configured SMTP service for arbitrary purposes.

item.title: Rockwell Automation 1756-ENT2R, 1756-EN4TR, 1756-EN4TRXT
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8007, CVE-2025-8008; Summary: Improper input validation and improper handling of exceptional conditions vulnerabilities in 1756-ENT2R, 1756-EN4TR, and 1756-EN4TRXT communication modules can lead to denial-of-service condition.

item.title: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Viewpoint
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Viewpoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7973; Summary: The vulnerability exists due to improper handling of MSI repair operations, allowing attackers to hijack the cscript.exe console window and spawn an elevated command prompt, enabling full privilege escalation.

item.title: Siemens SINUMERIK
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens SINUMERIK series; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40743; Summary: The SINUMERIK VNC access service has an authentication bypass vulnerability, allowing unauthorized remote access and potentially compromising system confidentiality, integrity, or availability.

item.title: Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Action Manager
